title: Domestic abuse and PFA orders
text:
Domestic abuse and PFA orders 0 comments 
In Adams County, as elsewhere, domestic abuse continues as a societal problem. In the next two columns we provide you information regarding domestic abuse and protection from abuse orders. Domestic abuse in Pennsylvania is defined as the occurrence of the following acts between family, intimate partners or household members: 
Causing/attempting to cause with or without a deadly weapon, bodily injury or serious bodily injury; rape; involuntary deviate sexual intercourse performed under force or the threat of force or while unconscious; sexual assault or statutory sexual assault; aggravated indecent assault under force or threat of force, or while unconscious; indecent assault (touching a person's intimate parts for the purposes of arousal without consent, under force/threat of force, or while they are unconscious); incest; placing another in reasonable fear of immediate serious bodily injury; false imprisonment; physical/sexual abuse of a child; engaging in a course of conduct or repeatedly committing acts toward another person, including following the person, under circumstances which place the person in reasonable fear of bodily injury. kAmp !C@E64E:@? uC@> p3FD6 @C56C W!upX :D 2 5@4F>6?E D:8?65 3J 2 ;F586 E6==:?8 E96 23FD6C E@ DE@A E96 23FD6 @C 7246 =682= 4@?D6BF6?46D] xE @776CD 4:G:= =682= AC@E64E:@? 7C@> 5@>6DE:4 G:@=6?46 E@ 76>2=6 2?5 >2=6 G:4E:>D] %96 EJA6 J@F >2J 86E 56A6?5D @?
